chapter.title: Uninstalling Nix
chapter.para: The following steps describes how to remove Nix from your system.
First of all you need to remove the /nix directory:
You also need to remove some files from your home directory:
Then you need to remove the line that references Nix from your $HOME/.profile. Assuming that your username is user it should look something like this:
chapter.screen: if [ -e /home/user/.nix-profile/etc/profile.d/nix.sh ]; then . /home/user/.nix-profile/etc/profile.d/nix.sh; fi # added by Nix installer
chapter.para: There might also be some configuration files in /etc/nix that you need to delete:
Finally, on a multi-user installation of Nix, you will also need to remove the nixbld[0-9] users.
chapter.screen: sudo deluser nixbld0 sudo deluser nixbld1 sudo deluser nixbld2 sudo deluser nixbld3 sudo deluser nixbld4 sudo deluser nixbld5 sudo deluser nixbld6 sudo deluser nixbld7 sudo deluser nixbld8 sudo deluser nixbld9
